name: Frederico Alvares
body:
**ASCOLA Research Team** ([IMT Atlantique](http://www.mines-nantes.fr)/[INRIA](http://www.inria.fr)/[LS2N](http://ls2n.fr))  
Institut Mines-Télécom Atlantique  
4 rue Alfred Kastler  
44307 Nantes  
France

Emails: [frederico.alvares[at]inria.fr](mailto:frederico.alvares@inria.fr) or [frederico.alvares[at]mines-nantes.fr](mailto:frederico.alvares@mines-nantes.fr).




# About Me
I obtained a B.Sc. degree in Computer Engineering at University of Pernambuco
(Brazil) in 2006. Then, I received a M.Sc. in Computer Engineering at the
Aeronautics Institut of Aeronautics (*Instituto Technologico de Aeronautica* -
ITA) in 2009. In 2013, I received a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science at University
of Nantes, thanks to my contributions related to the coordination of
Autonomic Cloud Services. From 2013 to 2015, I worked as a post-doctoral fellow
at INRIA Grenoble (France) on applying control-theoretical approaches to reconfigurable
software components. Since mid 2015, I have been working as a research/lecture associate at
Ecole des Mines de Nantes (France). My current research interests include the application
of of concepts of software engineering (architectures, models and languages) and control
theoretical approaches (e.g., discrete controller synthesis) to ease the
development and management of Self-adaptive Software Systems.

# Projects

* [CoMe4ACloud] (http://come4acloud.github.io) - Constraint and Model Engineering for Autonomic Clouds (2016-2017). AtlansTIC2020.
* [EPOC] (http://www.epoc.cominlabs.ueb.eu/) - Energy proportional and opportunistic computing systems (2013-2017). CominLabs.
* [MyCloud](http://www.agence-nationale-recherche.fr/suivi-bilan/editions-2013-et-anterieures/sciences-et-technologies-de-l-information-et-de-la-communication/ingenierie-numerique-securite/fiche-projet-arpege/?tx_lwmsuivibilan_pi2%5BCODE%5D=ANR-10-SEGI-0009) - SLA and Quality of Service for Cloud Computing (2010-2013). French National Research Agency (ANR).
* Petrilogic -  Teaching Environment for Formal Methods (2005-2006). IBM (Eclipse Innovation Grants).

# Teaching

## Current Academic Term (2016-2017)

* Object-oriented Programming (4th year)
* Imperative Programming (3rd year)
* Data bases (3rd year)
* Software Architecture - design patterns (5th year)
* Client-server Applications (5th year)
* Programming Project (3rd year)

## Previous years

* Data structures
* Human-machine interface
* UML
* Component-based Software Development with SCA and FraSCAti
* Formal Methods
* Compilers
